title: In vitro transcription of crRNA and tracrRNA from DNA oligos for cas9 enrichment and nanopore sequencing (for Bac - PULCE)
title_html: In vitro transcription of crRNA and tracrRNA from DNA oligos for cas9 enrichment and nanopore sequencing (for Bac - PULCE)

authors.name: Olin Silander
authors.note: School of Natural and computational sciences

source.title: Annealing T7 to crRNA and tracrRNA template

source.description: Add an equimolar amount of T7 primer to your crRNA pool. For example, reconstitute T7 primer to 10µM, and pool 125µL of your 10µM crRNA pool with 125µL of your T7 primer at 10µM.

source.title: Annealing T7 to crRNA and tracrRNA template

source.description: Add an equimolar amount of T7 primer to your tracrRNA. For example, if you have reconstituted your tracrRNA to 100µM, pool 125µL of your tracrRNA at 100µM to 125µL of your T7 primer at 100µM.

source.title: Annealing T7 to crRNA and tracrRNA template

source.description:
Anneal tracrRNA template + T7 primer and crRNA template + T7 primer by heating to
on a heat block or thermocycler for
and allowing them to cool to room temperature slowly on the bench in a tube rack.
For IVT we used the T7 E2050S kit from NEB and followed the standard RNA synthesis method. Thaw and keep on ice the necessary components - NTP buffer mix.

source.name: HiScribe T7 Quick High Yield RNA Synthesis Kit - 50 rxns

source.description:
Assemble the reactions in the following order in nuclease free 1.5ml lobbind tubes for both the crRNA & tracrRNA . total volume can be scaled accordingly. We usually had a total reaction volume of 90µL.
1xCrRNATracrRNA
Nuclease free waterXµLXµL
NTP buffer mix30µ30µ
Oligo RNA template(1µg)(1µg)
T7 Polymerase Mix6µL6µL
Total Volume Mix90µL90µL

1xCrRNATracrRNA
Nuclease free waterXµLXµL
NTP buffer mix30µ30µ
Oligo RNA template(1µg)(1µg)
T7 Polymerase Mix6µL6µL
Total Volume Mix90µL90µL

Incubate at
overnight. We usually incubate for 16 hours using a heat block.
Proceed to purification. We used Ampure beads to purify gRNAs after transcription.

source.name: SPRI beads (homemade) or Ampure XP beads

source.description: Equilibrate Ampure XP beads to room temperature.

For every 200 µL of IVT reaction, add 300µL of 100% ethanol (1:1.5 ratio i.e 90 µl IVT reaction mixture then add 135 µl of ethanol). The solution should turn a cloudy white (precipitation of RNA) upon addition of ethanol. This step helps the short RNAs bind to the beads. This can be done in several 1.5mL tubes.
For every 500µL of IVT reaction + 100% ethanol, add 500µL of Ampure XP beads to the solution (1:1 ratio i.e 225 µl) of IVT reaction and ethanol and mix well by inverting or pipetting with a P1000.

Incubate at room temperature for
.
Place the tubes on a 1.5 mL magnetic separation rack.

Wait
to allow the beads to separate if using a 1.5mL rack. Allow a longer time if necessary to ensure proper separation of beads liquid before proceeding. while waiting make up a batch of 80% ethanol for next step.
Remove and discard the supernatant while tube remains in magnetic rack.
Rinse the beads with 1mL of 80% ethanol if using a 1.5mL tube . It is not necessary to resuspend the beads.

Wait
then remove and discard the ethanol.

Repeat the wash step as described above. (Add the same amount of 80% ethanol, wait
, then discard the ethanol.)
Remove residual ethanol that collects at the bottom of the tube by using a P200 or P20.

Air dry the beads for
in a 1.5mL tube or until the beads lose their glossy appearance. Sufficiently dry beads will appear matte. Be careful not to let the beads get too dry (appearing cracked or dusty).

Elute the RNA by resuspending the beads with an appropriate amount of nuclease-free H2O depending on the desired volume and concentration. For the proceeding nanopore sequencing we usually elute with 30-50µL nuclease free H20.

Flick tubes to combine and allow the RNA to elute off the beads by incubating at room temperature for
.
If necessary, pulse-spin the tubes to collect any liquid along the sides of the tubes.
Place the tubes on the magnetic rack and allow them to separate until water is clear. This will take 5-10 minutes for a 1.5mL tube.
Collect the eluted RNA, being careful not to take up beads.

Using the XR RNA Qubit kit, quantify 1µL of the eluted tracrRNA and 1µL of the eluted crRNA. Follow standard XR RNA Qubit protocol. if concentration is too large to read initially make a 1 in 10 dilution.

Store RNA at
in small aliquots (we usually store 3µl-6µl aliquots in PCR tubes) in order to avoid freeze-thaws. The crRNA & tracrRNA should be freezed separately. Annealing to make the dgRNAs should be done only prior to sequencing.

source.title: Annealing T7 to crRNA and tracrRNA template

source.description: Pool your crRNA DNA oligo sequences in equimolar amounts. We order our crRNA templates from IDT with oligos diluted in nuclease free water at a concentration of 10µM in 1.5ml Eppendorf tubes.

In a PCR tube add:
10x CutSmart Buffer3µL
Your Genomic DNA24µL
Total reaction Volume 27µL
Mix gently by flicking tube and spin down.

10x CutSmart Buffer3µL
Your Genomic DNA24µL
Total reaction Volume 27µL

In a seperate 1.5mL Eppendorf Tube assemble:
Ligation Buffer (LNB)20µl
Nuclease free water3µl
NEBNext Quick T4 DNA ligase10µl
Adapter Mix (AMX)5µl
Total reaction volume 38µl
Mix by pipetting up and down to ensure viscous LNB is incorporated

Ligation Buffer (LNB)20µl
Nuclease free water3µl
NEBNext Quick T4 DNA ligase10µl
Adapter Mix (AMX)5µl
Total reaction volume 38µl

Add 20µl of this adapter ligation mix to the cleaved and dA-tailed sample in the other 1.5ml eppendorf tube. Mix gently by flicking up and down. immediately after mixing, add the remainder of the adapter ligation mixture to the cleaved and dA-tailed sample, which will yield an 80µl ligation mix.
Mix by flicking the tube and pulse spin to collect droplets.
Incubate mixture for
at room temperature.

source.title: Purify adapter ligated DNA - AMpure XP bead purification

source.description:
Add 1x volume (80µl) of TE pH8.0 to the ligation mix and mix by gentle flicking of the tube. Then add 0.3x volume (48uL) of AMPure XP beads to the ligation sample.
Gently invert tube then spin down
Incubate sample at room temperature for
- do not pipette or agitate sample.

source.title: Purify adapter ligated DNA - AMpure XP bead purification

source.description: Spin down sample and pellet on a magnetic rack, then pipette off the supernatant.

source.title: Purify adapter ligated DNA - AMpure XP bead purification

source.description:
Using 250µl of Short Fragment Buffer (SFB) resuspend the beads and flick to incorporate. Return tube to magnetic rack. Allow beads to pellet.
Remove supernatant via pipette and discard.
Repeat this SFB wash step.

source.title: Purify adapter ligated DNA - AMpure XP bead purification

source.description:
After removal of supernatant, let sample dry for
. Add 13uL of Elution Buffer (EB). Incubate for
at room temperature.
Pellet beads on a magnet and remove 12uL of eluate to a clean 1.5mL Eppendorf DNA LoBind Tube.
This prepared library will be used for loading into the flow cell. Store on ice until ready to load.

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description: Thaw sequencing buffer (SQB), loading beads (LB), Flush tether (FLT) and one tube of flush buffer (FB). After thawed place on ice.

source.title: Preparing input DNA *From Oxford nanopore protocol - please refer to their protocol for further detail

source.description: Prepare 5µg of high molecular weight genomic DNA (a range of 1-10µg can be used but we found that higher DNA input works better).

source.title: Preparing input DNA *From Oxford nanopore protocol - please refer to their protocol for further detail

source.description: Prepare DNA in nuclear free water to adjust to a 24µl total volume in a PCR tube. Flick and spin down to incorporate.

Preheat thermal cycler to
. Thaw an aliquot of NEB CutSmart Buffer, mix by vortexing and place on ice.

In a PCR tube add in the following order (ensure crRNA & tracrRNA are equimolar - 100µM):
Duplex Buffer8µL
crRNA pool (100µM)1µL
tracrRNA (100µM)1µL
Pipette mixture up and down. Place in thermal cycler for 5 mins at

Duplex Buffer8µL
crRNA pool (100µM)1µL
tracrRNA (100µM)1µL
Cool to room temperature and spin down to pool liquids - the crRNA : tracrRNA complexes will now be annealed.

In a 1.5ml Eppendorf tube
Annealed tracrRNA : crRNA complex 10µL
10x NEB cutsmart buffer10µL
Nuclease free H2O79.2µL
Pyrogenes Hifi Cas9 nuclease0.8µL
Total Volume 100µL
Mix by flicking tube and incubate at room temperature for 30 mins then place on ice, the RNP complexes are now formed.

Annealed tracrRNA : crRNA complex 10µL
10x NEB cutsmart buffer10µL
Nuclease free H2O79.2µL
Pyrogenes Hifi Cas9 nuclease0.8µL
Total Volume 100µL

source.title: Cleave and dA-tail the target DNA

source.description: Thaw dATP tube, vortex to mix and place on ice.

source.title: Cleave and dA-tail the target DNA

source.description: In a 1.5ml Eppendorf lobind tube make up dATP mix to 10mM stock. Vortex to mix and spin down (1µl of dATP to 9µl nuclease free water), then place on ice.

source.title: Cleave and dA-tail the target DNA

source.description:
To the PCR tubes containing the 30µl of desphophorylated DNA add:
Desphosphorylated genomic DNA sample30µl
Cas9 RNPs10µl
10 mM dATP1µl
NEB Taq polymerase1µl
Total reaction volume 42µl
Carefully mix the contents by inversion of tube, spin down and place in thermal cycler.
Incubate sample for the following cycle:
for
for
and hold at
.

Desphosphorylated genomic DNA sample30µl
Cas9 RNPs10µl
10 mM dATP1µl
NEB Taq polymerase1µl
Total reaction volume 42µl

RNAse Zap equipment, gloves and bench prior to starting protocol. Turn on heat block to reach a temperature of
.
Make up a batch of 80% ethanol for following wash steps. Usually 5ml is sufficient for washing both crRNA & tracrRNA tubes.

Add 3µl of CIP to the tube
Using a Thermocycler, incubate at
for
,
for
then hold at
.

Thaw Ligation Buffer (LNB) at room temperature, mix via pipetting due to viscosity. Place on ice.
Thaw the adaptor mix (AMX), mix by flicking tube and pulse spin. Return to ice.
Place Ampure XP beads at room temperature
Using a wide-bore tip transfer contents from the previous step from the PCR tube into a 1.5ml lobind eppendorf tube.

source.title: Purify adapter ligated DNA - AMpure XP bead purification

source.description:
Resuspend the AMpure XP beads by vortexing.
Thaw short fragment buffer (SFB) and EB from SQK-LSK109

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description:
Mix sequencing buffer (SQB) and flush buffer (FB) tubes by vortexing, spin down and return to ice.
Mix the flush tether (FLT) by pipetting, then return to ice.

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description:
Open the lid of the nanowire sequencing device and slide the flow cell's priming port cover clockwise so that the priming port is visible.
With a P1000µl pipette set to 200µl insert tip into the priming port and turn the wheel until the dial shows 220-230µl whereby a small volume of buffer will be seen in the tip.

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description: Prepare the flow cell priming mix: add 30µl of flush tether (FLT) directly to the tube of flush buffer (FB) and mix by pipetting up and down.

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description:
Load 800µl of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port, avoiding the introduction of air bubbles.
Wait

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description: Thoroughly mix the contents of the Loading beads (LB) via pipetting.

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description:
In a new 1.5ml lobind eppendorf tube prepare the library for loading:
Sequencing Buffer (SQB)25µl
Loading Beads (LB)13µl
DNA library12µl
Total volume50µl

Sequencing Buffer (SQB)25µl
Loading Beads (LB)13µl
DNA library12µl
Total volume50µl

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description:
Gently lift the sample port cover to make the sample port accessible.
Load 200µl of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port - avoiding the introduction of air bubbles.

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description: Mix the prepared library by gently pipetting up and down immediately prior to loading.

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description: Add 50µl of sample to the flow cell via the sample port in a slow drop wise fashion. Ensure each drop flows into the port before adding the next.

source.title: Priming and loading the flow cell

source.description: Gently replace the sample port cover, close the priming port and replace the MinION lid.
Follow the steps as outlined by Nanopore to start the sequencing run.

materials.name: SPRI beads (homemade) or Ampure XP beads
10X T7 Buffer (400 mM Tris pH 7.9 - 200 mM MgCl2 - 50 mM DTT - 20 mM spermidine (Sigma 85558)) store at -80C
Magnetic Tube Rack for 1.5mL or 15mL tubes

description:
For CRISPR-cas9 protocols including BAC-PULCE, T7 polymerase is used to transcribe the crRNA and tracrRNA to make dgRNA for cas9. The two components of the dual guides are the crRNA (containing your variable 20 nt target plus a 22 nt constant region) and the tracrRNA (a 72 nt constant region).
We used a combination of these protocols: 
https://www.protocols.io/view/in-vitro-transcription-for-dgrna-3bpgimn /dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.3bpgimn
https://international.neb.com/protocols/2013/04/02/standard-rna-synthesis-e2050
Nanopore protocol Cas-mediated PCR-free enrichment - please refer to this protocol in particular for further important detail around sequencing the DNA library.
Using modified “In Vitro Transcription for dgRNA V.2” (Lyden et al 2019):
In this protocol, we are designing crRNAs against which Cas9 will target. Using this sequence, we will add a T7 RNA polymerase binding site at the 5’ end, a 3’ tracrRNA binding site, and use the reverse complement of this to order our DNA oligos (below more details):
Designing crRNAs using CHOPCHOPv3 (Labun et al 2019), insert your gene target and CHOPCHOP will find a sequence of 20nt’s that will end in an  ‘NGG-3’
5’----NNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNGG----3’
where 20Ns are your target site. Cas9 cuts between the 17th and 18th N of your target.
The sequence of each crRNA should be as follows, with the Ns replaced by your 20 nt target:
TAATACGACTCACTATAGNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNGTTTTAGAGCTATGCTGTTTTG
The underline portion is the T7 RNA polymerase binding site. The addition at the 3’ end represents the region to which an 18mer will bind, in order to allow T7 a double stranded binding site.
18mer T7:
TAATACGACTCACTATAG
